meanings.definition: The quality or state of being selective or carefully chosen.
meanings.sent1: Her selectnesses in picking out the best apples at the market always impressed her friends.
meanings.sent2: The selectnesses of the chef in choosing the freshest ingredients for the dish was evident in its delicious taste.
meanings.sent3: The selectnesses of the cat in choosing which toy to play with made the other toys jealous.
meanings.sent4: His selectnesses in selecting the right words for his poem painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The selectnesses of the jeweler in picking the perfect diamond made the engagement ring sparkle brilliantly.

meanings.definition: The act of choosing or selecting carefully.
meanings.sent1: The selectnesses of the student in deciding which college to attend paid off in a successful academic career.
meanings.sent2: With great selectnesses, she picked the perfect gift for her best friend's birthday.
meanings.sent3: The selectnesses of the toddler in choosing bedtime stories often led to long nights of reading.
meanings.sent4: His selectnesses in selecting the right tools for the job made the project run smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The selectnesses of the curator in choosing artifacts for the exhibit made it a must-see for art enthusiasts.
